Name: H265ize
Overview:
h265ize is a fire and forget weapon. A nodejs utility utilizing ffmpeg to encode large quantities of videos with the hevc codec. For more information visit ayrton.sparling.us.
   [br][br]
   if you want to create the hvec file alongside your input file, put in the parent directory of your input For example: if your input is in /mnt/user/cache/medialib/mymedia/ set your output to /mnt/user/cache/medialib/

@attributes.Name: temp Directory
@attributes.Description: This is the mnt directory of your unraid server<br>Container path: /mnt

@attributes.Name: mnt Directory
@attributes.Description: This is the temp storage directory to store your current conversion<br>Container path: /tmp

@attributes.Name: Output Directory
@attributes.Description: The destination folder where you want your re-encoded video to be (recomended to be the parent directory of your input if you are planning to replace your source)

@attributes.Name: Input Directory
@attributes.Description: The source folder that contain video files you want to re-encode

@attributes.Name: Quantization Parameter
@attributes.Description: Quantization Parameter, read the h265 docs for more info

@attributes.Name: Quality Preset
@attributes.Description: ultrafast, superfast, veryfast, faster, fast, medium, slow, slower, veryslow, placebo | https://x265.readthedocs.io/en/default/presets.html for more info

DonateText: If you like it, then consider buying me a soda as I don't like beer :P
